summary: This document is a confidential investigative interview summary prepared by T&M USA, LLC for the Ghislaine Maxwell defense team. It details an interview with a former masseuse and model named Lauren Mack, conducted on July 23, 2021, with a follow-up on August 11, 2021. Mack describes her relationship with Jeffrey Epstein in the late 1990s, her interactions with Ghislaine Maxwell, and her observations, while consistently stating she did not witness any criminal activity involving underage girls.

persons.name: Lauren Mack
persons.context: The primary subject of the interview. She describes meeting Jeffrey Epstein through a modeling agency, working as his masseuse in the late 1990s, and her observations of Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. She states she did not witness any abuse or underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure discussed. Mack describes him as charming, a father figure, and her employer who paid her an allowance for massages. She mentions he sent her to give massages to his friends and discusses his properties and travel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Frequently discussed. Mack describes her as a 'corporate type' and 'house manager' for Epstein, taking helicopter lessons. She states Maxwell was not involved in sending her to give massages or in any 'shady' activities she witnessed.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Mack saw and that Epstein wanted her to give a massage to, which made her uncomfortable.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned briefly as someone Mack saw while with Epstein.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Epstein was involved with, which led to Mack's initial meeting with Epstein for a purported Victoria's Secret shoot.

persons.name: Virginia
persons.context: Referenced indirectly when Mack wonders if 'Virginia' (likely Virginia Giuffre) was at Epstein's house shortly after she met him, but states she never saw her.

connections.description: Mack describes Maxwell as handling business for Epstein, acting as a house manager and business partner/assistant.
Epstein paid Mack a monthly allowance for giving him massages and sent her to give massages to his friends. She viewed him as a father figure.
Mack wanted Maxwell to like her and they traveled together to London. Mack states Maxwell was not involved in any concerning activities she witnessed.
Epstein wanted Mack to give Prince Andrew a massage, indicating a social connection.
Mack states Epstein was 'involved with' Wexner, which was the pretext for her initial meeting with Epstein.

events.title: Mack's Time with Epstein
events.description: Lauren Mack states she was with Jeffrey Epstein around 1999, working as his masseuse and traveling to his various properties before leaving right before 2000.

events.title: Interview with Lauren Mack
events.description: Initial interview of Lauren Mack conducted by investigators for the Ghislaine Maxwell defense team.

events.title: Follow-up with Lauren Mack
events.description: Follow-up responses provided by Lauren Mack to the defense investigators.

events.title: Trip to London
events.description: Mack traveled to the UK with Epstein and Maxwell. There, she had a fling with an Irishman which upset Maxwell and Epstein.

locations: 230 Park Avenue, Suite 440, New York, NY 10169
keyFacts: The interviewee, Lauren Mack, a former masseuse, states she never witnessed Ghislaine Maxwell involved in procuring or grooming girls for Jeffrey Epstein, nor did she see any underage girls at Epstein's properties during her time with him (1999-ish).

Mack describes being sent by Epstein to give massages to his friends, which led her to later wonder if she was being 'set up to be exchanged,' though she states this did not occur to her at the time and that Maxwell was not involved in these arrangements.
Mack characterizes Maxwell as a 'house manager' and 'business partner/assistant' to Epstein who was taking helicopter lessons to fly him to his island.
Mack mentions seeing Prince Andrew and Donald Trump in Epstein's social circle, and that Epstein wanted her to give Prince Andrew a massage, which made her uncomfortable.
The document is a defense-team-commissioned investigative interview, suggesting an effort to gather exculpatory or mitigating evidence regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's role.
